name: Email Answerer
description: Generates responses to emails based on a given context and memory, and logs answered emails in a database.
author: Shinkai

response_context.description: Instructions and context for generating email responses. Used to maintain consistent tone

from_date.description: Start date for email fetch in DD-Mon-YYYY format (e.g., '01-Jan-2024'). Optional filter

to_date.description: End date for email fetch in DD-Mon-YYYY format (e.g., '31-Jan-2024'). Optional filter

table_created.description: True if answered_emails SQLite table was created successfully

mail_ids.description: Array of unique IDs for successfully processed and answered emails

skipped.description: Array of email IDs that were skipped (e.g., already answered or invalid)

login_status.description: Login status: 'success' or error message if authentication failed

sqlTables.name: answered_emails
sqlTables.definition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS answered_emails (email_unique_id TEXT UNIQUE PRIMARY KEY, subject TEXT NOT NULL, email TEXT NOT NULL, response TEXT NOT NULL, received_date DATETIME NOT NULL, response_date DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)

sqlQueries.name: Insert new email
sqlQueries.query: INSERT INTO answered_emails (email_unique_id, subject, email, response, received_date) VALUES (:emailUniqueId, :subject, :email, :response, :receivedDate)
